intro: Pausinystalia gilgii, commonly known as the African arrow poison, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family. The plant is notable for its toxic properties, particularly the presence of cardioactive steroids in its leaves and stems. These compounds have historically been used by indigenous peoples for hunting and ritual purposes. Its botanical features include a tall, slender stem and large, pinnately compound leaves.
